title: Charged sphere moving between charged plates

content.question: A small negatively charged sphere is traveling horizontally with speed <math alttext="v" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> to the right when it enters the region between two parallel, oppositely charged plates. Assume the electric field is negligible outside the region between the plates. The sphere enters the region between the plates at time <math alttext="t equals 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and exits the region at <math alttext="t equals t sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following pairs of graphs depicts the horizontal and vertical positions as functions of time for the particle while the particle is in the region between the plates and for a short time after the particle leaves this region? Use the coordinate system indicated in the figure and assume the effects of gravity are negligible.

choices.label: The figure presents two graphs in the coordinate plane. The first graph has the horizontal axis labeled t and vertical axis labeled x. A vertical line labeled t sub 0 intersects the horizontal axis at a point slightly more than halfway across the axis. The line begins halfway up the vertical axis above the origin and moves horizontally to the right, continuing beyond the vertical line labeled t sub 0 until reaching the rightmost point on the horizontal axis. The second graph has the horizontal axis labeled t and vertical axis labeled y. The line begins on the vertical axis slightly above the origin and gradually curves upwards and to the right at an increasing rate, continuing beyond the vertical line labeled t sub 0, ending at the rightmost point on the horizontal axis and two thirds of the way up the vertical axis.
